title:
Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site
: Collections
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections               Collections         3rd President, Vivian Carter Mason, and the Archives Committee at the Council House, c. 1954. NPS, National Archives for Black Women's History  Inspired by her friend and colleague, Dr. Carter G. Woodson, Mary McLeod Bethune collected and preserved African American women's history. The National Park Service continues to preserve this invaluable archive. Today, the National Archive for Black Women's History remains the only archive solely dedicated to African American women.   Interested in accessing the archive? Visit our Archives page to learn more.
